info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Jeff Davis and northeastern Presidio Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm producing a landspout near Bloys Camp, or 16 miles northwest of Marfa, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Davis, Bloys Camp, McDonald Observatory, Davis Mountains State Park, Marfa Municipal Airport, Black Mountain, Indian Lodge and Fort Davis National Historical Site. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Texas.
